extension_description.message: Share and skip YouTube video's commercial segments

thank_you.message: Thank you for installing ADWHORE.NET chrome extension!

welcome_info_1.message: You're ready to block annoying 3rd party advertisements that adwhores bomb you on Youtube!

welcome_info_2.message: You can close this window right now or go through a brief tutorial to learn more about extension! (not aval. at the moment)

welcome_info_3.message: To make your contribution fun, please choose your side!

faction_1_desc.message:
You will not find any kind of bad jokes here.

Neutral team

faction_2_desc.message:
It's still cold war which main battlefield is Youtube now.

Soviet KGB actively recruits Youtubers to lure citizens of the free world to the Red side!!!

You have to stop this! Protect your homeland from communist nasty propaganda!

Report illegal activities today, or tomorrow it will be too late!

faction_3_desc.message:
It's still cold war which main battlefield is Youtube now.

CIA actively recruits our Youtubers to target our citizens with their false ideas!

You have to stop our enemies! Protect our motherland!

Report illegal activities today, or tomorrow it will be too late for us!

note_the_alpha.message:
Please remember that ADN is still young and stupid.
Don't expect much, okay? Thanks.

skip_trust_selector_title.message: This system is being actively improved. The concept is as follows: for each report, a confidence level is calculated, what is the probability that there is exactly what the user reported: from 0 to 100 percent. The level depends on many factors: the reputation of the reporter, the number of likes and reports, as well as the level of reputation of those who liked and those who reported, whether the report was checked by a moderator, etc. If the level of trust is higher than the one specified here, it will be skipped automatically, if not, an unobtrusive button will be offered to skip.

acceptable_selector_title.message: An acceptability level is calculated for each known ad: from 0 to 100 percent. It depends on many factors: the type of ad, the attempt to abuse trust, and the blogger's overall rating based on previously known integrations. For example, if a blogger tries to fit to advertising is creative and does not try to deceive his viewer, the level of tolerance for any of his ads will be higher. And if he was involved in advertising scammers, the level of tolerance for any of his ads (even honest) will be less and such ads will be scrolled automatically. in active development.

table_title_title.message: If the checkbox is checked and the ad segment has a sufficient confidence level for autoskip, it will be skipped.

bad_ads_title.message: Condemned ads: scammers, abuse of trust, as well as ads that do not correspond to the topic of the channel

acceptable_ads_title.message: Acceptable advertising: admitting the fact of advertising, and advertising other YouTube channels similar to this one

awesome_ads_title.message: Approved ads: advertising your side projects, collaborations with other bloggers

bad_youtuber_title.message: If a blogger has inserted an ad into his video but ignored the YouTube rule.

good_youtuber_title.message: If a blogger has inserted an ad into his video and mentioned it in video's settings.

bad_ambassador_title.message: Ambassadors are ADN-friendly bloggers who support the project and distribute it to their audience. They are carefully checked and it usually doesn't make sense to automatically skip their ads.

good_ambassador_title.message: Ambassadors are ADN-friendly bloggers who support the project and distribute it to their audience. They are carefully checked and it usually doesn't make sense to automatically skip their ads.

sponsorBlock.message: SponsorBlock is a similar project, started a year before ADN. Auto-skipping from SB is disabled because ADN cannot guarantee the validity of segments received from the API. In general, ADN and SB are similar, but have completely different goals. The main purpose of ADN - to replay and destroy the adwhores on YouTube, collect data on advertising integrations of all bloggers, process them and highlight conscientious youtubers among the corrupt ones, provide them with all kinds of information support, along the way destroying the reputation and income of those bloggers who have already exhausted themselves long ago. ADN's main priority is Russian YouTube, then English, then the rest world. SB is more focused on English-speaking YouTube and simply blocks sponsored ads, not understanding its types and quality. You can read more about the fundamental differences between ADN and SB on GitHub

category0Text.message: 🎲🤬🤮 | SSL: advertising of scammers, bookmakers, casinos, pyramids, investments

category0Title.message: Select this item if your ad is designed to find a random victim among your audience.

category1Text.message: 🥱🥵😔 | Prescribed ad insert not voiced by blogger

category1Title.message: Who is this unrecognized genius that invented this?

category2Title.message: Select this item if your ad is designed to find a random sucker among your audience.

category3Title.message: Select this item if the author himself recorded the advertising integration, came up with a creative approach to its implementation.

category4Text.message: 🤔🤨🧐 | The blogger has received a product from the advertiser and is reviewing it

category4Title.message: Select this item if the content consists of a review of a product for which the blogger did not pay. The blogger's marketability in this case is determined by the second checkbox

category5Text.message: 😡🧑‍🎤👩‍🎤 | Advertising of other channels with dissimilar topics

category5Title.message: Select this option if the author advertises another channel on YouTube, which is not related to the topic

category6Text.message: 🤔👨‍🎤👨‍🎤 | Ads for other channels with similar topics ❤️️‍

category6Title.message: We do not have the right to automatically skip such advertisements, collaboration in related fields is normal. But we will, if you want, of course.

category7Text.message: 🤔👭👌 | Advertising of another blogger who starred in the video (collaboration) ❤️‍

category7Title.message: Select this option if the blogger is advertising another blogger with whom he has recorded a joint video.

category8Text.message: 👌👌👌 | Advertising of your projects, social networks, channels ❤️‍

category8Title.message: Select this item if the blogger has advertised his own project, it can be twitch, merch or a second channel.

category9Title.message: Select this item if you really liked the way the blogger got creative with advertising.

category10Text.message: 🤔🤔🤔 | I can't describe what it was, but I thought it was an advertisement

category10Title.message: Check this box if you spot an ad but it doesn't fit into any category.

clickHelp1.message: Click if you don't understand what's going on

clickHelp2.message: Click to learn how to select a category

help1.message:
Thanks for contributing!

First, you need to select two points of the segment: start and end.

Click on the field to the right (end) or left (start), TAB switches between them.

Steps by arrows: right / left - 2 sec, up / down - 0.1 sec.
In the field itself there are built-in arrows with a step of 0.25 sec.

Space - pause / start, Enter - saves the current video time in the field .

You can also select with the mouse on the progress bar, the slider shows active selection of the beginning or end.

Yellow bar shows the selected fragment.

Buttons can be used to check how the fragment begins and ends.

And in the next step you can check it out!

And remember: it's hard to learn, easy to fight!

P.S. If you lose the control unit, make the player wider.

help2.message:
First make sure you have selected the correct segment.

Click the button on the left to test skipping it.

Are you sure the segment is correct? Then select a category from the menu on the left and check the checkboxes.

This will help distinguish acceptable from bad ads and form an ADN opinion about the blogger.

Your segment will immediately become available to all users, but it will be automatically skipped only if it has enough trust points (TP).

When the moderator checks it or a user with a bunch of TP, you will also get some TP.

The more TP you have, the more valuable your likes / segment reports and the higher the impact on other users.

Remember that the contribution of any user can be extracted without harm to the community so don't overuse TP, please.

Good luck! ADWHORE.NET guarantees that no contribution will go unnoticed!

helpMePlease.message:
Click on the button to my right and follow the instructions of the button with the question mark.

If you don't see anything, make the player wider.

markIn.message: Click to start at the beginning of the segment

markOut.message: Click to start at the end of the segment

checkOne.message: Click the checkbox if the blogger did not notify that there will now be an advertisement. An example of a correct notification: a signature on the installation, or a warning in the spirit: and now there is a my sponsor blablabla..

checkTwo.message: Click the checkbox if a blogger, advertising something, seemed insincere to you. Example: monotonous reading of a ready-made text at gunpoint, obvious insincerity. the product he just saw

checkThree.message: Click the checkbox if you think the blogger received money for his ad

pleaseEnterComment.message:
Please enter comment, just 2-3 words.
Example: 'VPN', 'shit F2P', '1xbet', 'Fraud'
It will be useful for ADN in the future.

categoryMissing.message:
You have not selected a category.

Please select an ad category and check the checkboxes.
This will help us determine whether an ad is acceptable or not

plsDontSendWholeVideo.message:
You seem to be trying to send an ad segment longer than 90% of the video.
We cannot accept such a segment.
ADN is sent with ad integrations, and you are sending a whole ad video.
A person opening a video wants to watch it but not skip completely.
Perhaps in the future we will make a special notion that the video is a commercial.
Soryan :(

countryStatsWIP.message: There should be statistics for your country, but I'm still working on it! Check it out later. P.S. You can hide flags in ADWHORE.NET extension settings.

404.message: Our users haven't watched this video yet. You can be the first! Click on the button to learn how to send a report! P.S. You can hide flags in ADWHORE.NET extension settings.

clickToViewColdWarStats.message: . Click to view Cold War statistics. P.S. You can hide flags in ADWHORE.NET extension settings.
